intro: Pilosella auriculoides, commonly known as the auriculate pilosella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cluster, with narrow, hairy leaves that are often lobed at the base. It typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Pilosella auriculoides is a herbaceous perennial that is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable conditions.
